intro: Cybianthus sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenisi's cybianthus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Sint Eustatius in the Caribbean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in rocky or coastal areas. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
